item.title: CVE-2017-2668|2024-08-05T14:02:07.340Z -- %5Bunknown%5D -- 389-ds-base
item.description: 389-ds-base before versions 1.3.5.17 and 1.3.6.10 is vulnerable to an invalid pointer dereference in the way LDAP bind requests are handled. A remote unauthenticated attacker could use this flaw to make ns-slapd crash via a specially crafted LDAP bind request, resulting in denial of service.

item.title: CVE-2018-10850|2024-08-05T07:46:47.455Z -- %5Bunknown%5D -- 389-ds-base
item.description: 389-ds-base before versions 1.4.0.10, 1.3.8.3 is vulnerable to a race condition in the way 389-ds-base handles persistent search, resulting in a crash if the server is under load. An anonymous attacker could use this flaw to trigger a denial of service.

item.title: CVE-2019-14824|2024-08-05T00:26:39.128Z -- %5Bunknown%5D -- 389-ds-base
item.description: A flaw was found in the 'deref' plugin of 389-ds-base where it could use the 'search' permission to display attribute values. In some configurations, this could allow an authenticated attacker to view private attributes, such as password hashes.

item.title: CVE-2018-14624|2024-08-05T09:29:51.694Z -- %5Bunknown%5D -- 389-ds-base
item.description: A vulnerability was discovered in 389-ds-base through versions 1.3.7.10, 1.3.8.8 and 1.4.0.16. The lock controlling the error log was not correctly used when re-opening the log file in log__error_emergency(). An attacker could send a flood of modifications to a very large DN, which would cause slapd to crash.

item.title: CVE-2018-10871|2024-08-05T07:46:47.376Z -- %5Bunknown%5D -- 389-ds-base
item.description: 389-ds-base before versions 1.3.8.5, 1.4.0.12 is vulnerable to a Cleartext Storage of Sensitive Information. By default, when the Replica and/or retroChangeLog plugins are enabled, 389-ds-base stores passwords in plaintext format in their respective changelog files. An attacker with sufficiently high privileges, such as root or Directory Manager, can query these files in order to retrieve plaintext passwords.
